title: [K-12] Designing ICT-Based Creative Music Composition Education

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of basic music theory (harmony, chord progressions) and experience with digital audio workstations (DAWs)
context.additional_context: Learners use personal devices (tablets/laptops) to operate DAW (Digital Audio Workstation) software and cloud-based collaboration tools. Conducted as project-based learning with case studies, emphasizing iterative improvement and peer feedback in creative development

learning_goals: Using ICT tools, one can analyze genre-specific musical proscription constraints and apply creative composition techniques to expand them
Through case studies, compare structural elements of various musical works and produce a polished digital music piece of over three minutes based on this analysis
Continuously improve the composition process by incorporating peer feedback and present the final work in an online portfolio format

resources: Educational licenses for DAW software (Logic Pro, Ableton Live, etc.)
External sound libraries and sample packs

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
